rComments: Very rich, interesting seminar. Prof is very knowlegeable, funny, brings the class to life, provides good feedback. Cool group exercises in the classroom - really like the extra ways to participate, for marks!I lots to read but definitely recommend it!
I love this man. Best Prof in the Politics Department Hands Down.

I came into his class with high expectations and was repeatedly disappointed. His assignment scheduling is erratic and he assigned a lot of unnecessary extra work. In seminars, he was condescending and often high-jacked students' discussion points. He would criticize presenters as they were presenting. Avoid if possible.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Amazing Professor hoping to take more courses with him in the future.

I've had him for two classes - POL208 and POL340 - and I'm so glad I had him. He is literally my favorite prof at UTM. All the other reviews are correct; he does care about students. His office hours are extremely helpful, ahd he's just a standup guy altogether. If you get him for any of your PoliSci classes, you're in luck.

I really like prof because of how caring he was. He's the only prof that has ever bothered to learn my name and he pays attention to your interests. However, the exams are the hardest I've ever taken in the political science department. The multiple choice was brutal and he doesn't really give guidelines on what content to study.

Very sweet professor, definitely a gem. You learn a lot but there is so much content get ready for your brain to explode. Final exam was the hardest thing I've done in my entire life. Hard to fail the course if you don't keep up with assignments, gives you plenty of opportunities to succeed.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Hilarious', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: He is a teddy bear. So nice to talk to and he truly cares about his students. If you have any problems or concerned let him know and he will accommodate you. His powerpoints are amazing and have everything you need to know.
Best Professor i've had so far! Really easy to talk too and plans fun movie and pizza parties during the end of the course and the midterm. 11/10 RECOMMEND!!

Professor Kotsovilis is one of the best at UTM! He is very approachable and helpful with any questions you have. Very kind and sweet man! No textbook, just his slides that clearly explain everything. Tests are based on all material, just memorizing.

Professor Kotsovilis is caring and willing to help those who seek it. He is happy to answer any questions and will spend as long as needed explaining it. His tests are heavy on memorization as well as long.

Genuinely the sweetest man ever! Very approachable, and truly cares about how his students do! Extends deadlines to help students, and goes the extra mile in lecture by engaging students in games to make people understand. He is hilarious in class, you must be insane to not like him! Tests are hard, really know the material inside out.
teacherRatingTags: ['Inspirational', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Does tend to go 15-30 minutes over class but really wants you to learn the material and wants you to do well on the assignments, often will give extenstions
By far the most inspirational and caring professor in UofT. His knowledge is immense, and he does a very good job transferring it onto the students in a clear fashion. Also, very witty.
organized,  knowlegeable, gives excellent feedback, makes class interesting. taking another course of his,
He is easily one of the best professors on Campus. His lectures and readings are very inspiring. He is extremely intelligent and I urge you to attend his office hours!

Great prof. I learned a lot from his class. The lectures were clear, well structured and funny. Makes you understand international relations and uses references from current affairs, too. Exams tough but fair, he cares a lot for his students, despite a huge size class, meeting individually for our final papers with every one of us!!!!
He was a fair grader and much of the course material was interesting; however, he was also patronizing, stoic, and unapproachable.
Inspiring and very funny.
Very interesting class. Would highly recommend. He is a  fair grader, gives great feedback, is funny, clearly knows his stuff.
One of the best classes. Great prof, cool lectures, cares a lot about students.
I enjoyed his class. Guy certainly knows his stuff and is funny.
He is the best. I plan to take any course he offers. I learned a lot and had fun doing so!

Interesting course, very enjoyable and learnt lots, can be hard to hear sometimes and sometimes says one thing on the assignment sheet and syllabus and then gives other insturections in class and uses only online readings

I had to drop his class because his accent was so intense, I was actually having trouble understanding him. Certain words...I would hear them as something else, and just get lost in the lecture. Nice guy, material that you can read on the slides is easy to understand.

This is my first time writing a prof review, because this guy truly deserves it. If you are interested in international relations, this prof is perfect. He is genuinely interested in his students succeeding, is very helpful when you talk to him and is very knowledgable. Plus, you have to appreciate his humour. Very inspirational individual.
drags lectures, very boring, posts slides online right before class, fair tests, willing to help, just ask for it
Doesn't use a mic so can be hard to hear wants everyone to do well and makes course material interesting does have a movie night at the end of each semseter which is fun. All readings are online.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]
